means: 尊敬的，表示敬意的，敬称的

sentence.Network_en: He was given the honorific title of national chairman.
sentence.Network_cn: 他被授予国家主席的尊称。

sentence.Network_en: All employees will refer to each other by the honorific suffix "san".
sentence.Network_cn: 所有雇员相互称呼时都须在名字后添加敬语san（日语表示“先生”，“女士”）。

sentence.Network_en: His use of the honorific'sir " would multiply while he assumed a glacial demeanor.
sentence.Network_cn: 他会摆出一副冷若冰霜的样子,并不断使用 “ 阁下 ” 这种尊称.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 克林贡语词典（第四章动词） ... <continuous 连续>。另一方面，{- <honorific 敬语> <I am honored to see you 见到您是我的荣幸&gt.
分级前后缀词根-蒋争 - 豆丁网 ... stupefaction 麻醉状态 - ） honorific 尊敬的， terrific 令人害怕的，.
略称... ... 或称 also known as;also called 敬称 honorific;term of respect 旧称 old term;old way of referring to sth.

list.abs: politeness in Chinese is often achieved by using honorific alternatives , prefixing or suffixing a word with a polite complement , or simply by dropping casual-sounding words .礼貌往往是在中国所取得的替代品使用敬语，前缀或suffixing一个字一个有礼貌的补充，或只是拖放休闲冠冕堂皇的话。
Howdy , honorific lady , very happy have this opportunity to accept your personal interview here again ., 您好 , 尊敬的女士 , 很高兴有这个机会再这里接受你的面试.

honorific guests : when you change sanitary towels , please put the used one into basket , thank you for your support and contribution to environmental protection .尊敬的宾客：如阁下需要更换巾类等，请将巾类放入竹筐内，感谢您对环保的支持与贡献！
honorific customer , once receiving your message , we will give you the reply as soon as possible !尊敬的客户，一旦收到您的留言，我们将尽快给您答复！

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin honorificus, from honor 'honour'

entry.tran: （称号或说话方式）表示尊敬的
entry.def: An honorific title or way of talking is used to show respect or honour to someone.

example.ex: He was given the honorific title of national chairman...
example.tran: 他被授予国家主席的尊称。

example.ex: All employees will refer to each other by the honorific suffix 'san'.
example.tran: 所有雇员相互称呼时都须在名字后添加敬语san（日语表示“先生”，“女士”）。

means.word_mean: 1. conferring or showing honor or respect;

sentences.sentence: "honorific social status commonly attaches to membership in a recognized profession"

auth_sentence.content: The honorific Mr was used, to the disgust of the NCOs.
auth_sentence.res_content: The honorific Mr was used, to the disgust of the NCOs.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The honorific Mr was used, to the disgust of the NCOs.

auth_sentence.content: Monsignor Mode of address for members of clergy holding honorific titles granted by the Pope, usually at the request of a bishop.
auth_sentence.res_content: Monsignor Mode of address for members of clergy holding honorific titles granted by the Pope, usually at the request of a bishop.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Monsignor Mode of address for members of clergy holding honorific titles granted by the Pope, usually at the request of a bishop.

auth_sentence.content: He says authorities have no legal reason to detain U Gambira, whom he referred to using the honorific "Shin," given to monks.
auth_sentence.res_content: He says authorities have no legal reason to detain U Gambira, whom he referred to using the honorific "Shin," given to monks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He says authorities have no legal reason to detain U Gambira, whom he referred to using the honorific "Shin," given to monks.
